answers.answer: Ive discovered carrot cake fulfills the sweet tooth doesn't raise sugar much. I buy it in little 6oz servings at walamrt n eat 1/3 at a time also I drink a bottle of water with it.
Sugar free Popsicles are a huge help to me.
I'm a diabetic and 28 weeks...I cave sweets too lol. Try baking with splenda instead of sugar...they have a lot of splenda cake and cookie recipes.

It sounds crazy but its the most delicious thing I've had in my life:If you have a magic bullet like thing that breaks down dry food to powder...4 Seedless Dates1 tlbsp Flax seed3/4 cup Raw almondsPut all this in the "food processor" or whatever you have.Then roll the "dough" into balls munchkin doughnut size.Roll into powdered coconut.I'm not kidding this stuff is heaven!  It's sweet and almost creamy amazing goodness and super duper healthy!
Also sugar free angel food cake, sugar free cool whip, strawberries and blueberries.... add all together lol... Yum! And not to bad for you!

question: Hi,I was diagnosed with gestational diabetes at 29 weeks. I have been eating very well - watching my carbs and sugar intakes. However sometimes I really want to eat some sweets ... bakery most of all! I'm looking for some recipes and great ideas that you have used to keep down cravings and keep glucose level in a normal range. I still have at least 6 or more weeks to go ...Thanks :)
title: Gestational diabetes at 31 weeks. Need ideas for quiet sweet cravings
